metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9811 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
As part of a winning Pwn2Own entry, a researcher demonstrated a sandbox escape by installing a malicious language pack and then opening a browser feature that used the compromised translation. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
